definitions.definition: used to ask somebody to repeat something because you did not hear it or did not understand it

examples.text: ‘You're very quiet today.’ ‘Pardon?’ ‘I said you're very quiet today.’

definitions.definition: used by some people to say ‘sorry’ when they have said or done something wrong, usually by accident

wordOrigin: Middle English: from Old French pardun (noun), pardoner (verb), from medieval Latin perdonare ‘concede, remit’, from per- ‘completely’ + donare ‘give’.
